ratings.comment: Stat 303 itself was not too bad; it was Bo Yang that made it miserable. He doesn't explain things well, and the lectures were not very good. For being a 1 credit class, definitely takes a lot of time/effort. I recommend a different professor, if possible. This course is definitely doable with him, as long as you can self-teach/spend lots of time.

Would not wish him on my worst enemy. His lectures are awful, he does not know how to teach, and he's full of himself. For his lectures he just copies some other guys code that you have access to on video anyways and claims it is his. Everything the other bad ratings say are 200% true
I'm kinda suprised that he's got a 1.7 right now. Just aviod him if you can
He is okay

I don't understand the hate honestly. Tough to understand at times, but covered the material straight from the textbook so you could reference it later. Homework took a long time some weeks, but was manageable. Exams weren't easy, but he didn't ask anything that wasn't on the homework or review. The final being 30% was scary, but turned out okay.

I dont know how this school keeps finding terrible professors like Bo.

Just try to avoid him, he cant teach.
AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID!

Professor Yang is a terrible professor! He presents the material as if it's extremely simple, meanwhile many students are lost. He is very disorganized at times, and he gets irritated when students ask questions. Most of the time he is flat-out rude and has yelled at students during class. Hands down the worst professor I've had at UW by a MILE!

RUN! Bo needs to learn how to treat students with respect and stop blaming students for his own faults. Lectures are useless and he won't release grades until months after the end of the class. Don't waste your time to take his class. If you have to take this class, at least choose the online sections so you don't need to interact with him.

The class is generally very hard, but Bo does a pretty good job of explaining the topics. He doesn't provide great materials outside of class, so attending class, for me, was a MUST. The lecture notes were not very clear, but he explains better in class. Front heavy class, easy end of the class.
Straightforward

Not an easy class but you are able to understand the topics and help is accessible in this class. Pretty straightforward homework and exams. Extra credit opportunities available that would have raised my grade even more. Definitely recommend.
Great Prof, easy course, and not too much homework. Just keep studying 4 hours before the exam, and you will get an A.

Never ever choose this teacher, He is so mean because he judges other student ability with discrimination. A person was confused by a question, so they just post on piazza, Bo just said improve your reading ability. He even does not post due date. You must click into this courses instead of calendar.

Run. When asking for help on anything related to the class, instead of helping he'll say google it because "how am I supposed to know the answer" His lectures are not helpful at all, for any assignments, I had to YouTube everything, the only reason I passed the class. He likes to talk about how he learned all this information (R Studio) by himself

BOzo is a perfect description for Bo. Guy is hard to understand, rude, and spends class just rewriting his slides. If you think he's going to teach you the material or even be nice to you, then you're in the wrong place. If you can, avoid him at all costs.

Bo Yang is the least respectful professor I have ever seen. Could not organize a class at all, lectures were pointless and just followed a sheet. He told a student asking a clarifying question  
"If you think the wording is confusing, you'd better improve your reading comprehension in some ways" Save yourself from a rude & disrespectful professor
Excellent!
run. Would Never take this professor's class.
310 is super easy, and I recommend taking this class.

Every worst aspect as a teacher you can imagine you can find on him. He may be terrible at teaching, but he's talented at ruining your day and your whole semester. There is 3 homework due in 8 days and most of the questions he hasn't taught. He is much behind his original schedule, and suddenly speed up to catch up schedule at the end of semester.
Just avoid him if you can. This guy will ruin your day if you have him.
Exams are nothing the same as homework or practice exams. Lectures are not super helpful, though lectures notes are sometimes helpful.

Quite possibly the worst professor in all of Wisconsin - avoid him like the plague. Disorganized, short-tempered, aggressive, and un-responsive. Really hope the guy is doing alright if I'm being completely honest. Kind of worrying how it seems like he just doesn't care about anything at all besides becoming frustrated with his students.
You are better off learning from Google than him. Probably one of the most passive-aggressive professors I have had here.

Every single aspect of this course has been hand-crafted by Bo to be as infuriating as humanly possible. He even disabled the feature on canvas where it tells you your total score. As far as content difficulty on a scale of 1-10, the homework is a 2, the lectures a 4, the exams an 8, and the discussions a full 10. Nothing about it makes any sense.

I can forgive professors for being bad at teaching if they at least try to be helpful otherwise. Bo is the worst of both worlds in this respect. It's best to pretend he doesn't exist: lectures are a waste of time and asking for help won't help. The extent of your interaction with him should be the poorly worded emails he sends before each exam.

His lectures are basically talking about his own R programming experience, which is useless. He learned R by himself which shows he is unprofessional. The homework, quizzes are the copy of another prestigious professor. Learned nothing from his class although the exam is not really hard.

I took his online class to learn about the data programming language, R. He has never taken a class on R, and did not design this class, yet he is still teaching it. He is very dismissive and unprofessional in email. Do not take this class if you don't have to.

He is really bad at teaching. What he teaches in the class is almost the same as the handouts given. The lecture is totally useless. You need to teach yourself for the course and be prepared for the hard and endless exams.

His lectures are really bad, the class is structured pretty alright in general. If you don't mind basically teaching yourself everything you should be fine. I had a really good TA that graded everything fairly and answered questions. Forget about asking Bo Yang a question, he'll just tell you to pay more attention to the lecture.
You need to understand that by taking his class you can only count on yourself to learn everything.

If you can avoid this professor, please do. I have had him twice and he mentioned that he has never taken a stats class or a class in R, which is what he teaches. Why should we learn from him then? He is terrible at answering questions and is kind of just a miserable person to be around. He is the worst professor I have had so far.

The construction of the class is to the students advantage, with quizzes allowing infinite attempts and the homework being fairly straightforward. Professor Yang is not incredibly accessible or immediately helpful, but his general is sensible. If you try in this class, you will do well, but youve got to try. He also extended a hard homework.

Bo is so rude, my gosh. Interacting with him was such a pain to the point where I didn't want to email him or talk to him during class because he would just flip out at me for no reason. I got an A in this class because I had covered the content at a high-pace job I did over the summer, but he does absolutely nothing to help with gaining R skills

The lectures are only giving you the basics. To complete HW and quizzes you need to do 10 more steps, so expect to spend a lot of time outside class understanding and trying to write your own code. Bo's lectures are useful to understand the material but when it comes to helping, he isn't willing to help that much.

Yang is kind of impatient to students and his lecture is boring. He simply runs his code and expects us to understand the output by ourselves. You would have to work a lot after class to keep up if you have never learnt RStudio before. But the final is not so hard as long as you do all the homework and quizzes.

STAT327 part 1 is not bad since it is pretty easy, you'll be fine if you take this. Part2 and Part3 is a nightmare. Homework is impossible, lectures are boring and will not help you with the homework. Expect to spend hours on stackexchange on the homework. AVOID part2 and part3 with this professor AT ALL COST! This class will make you miserable.

He is actually pretty rude and impatient with students. For a lot of non-statistics students, 327 is kind of an intro level classes and are supposed to be well-structured. But he ruined my experience in this field and don't actually helpful at all. Worst professor and worst class in Madison. I think the school should stop hiring him to teach.
How is he a professor? Honestly he should not be allowed to teach any where let alone the University of Wisconsin-Madison.
He is the worst professor I have ever had. He doesn't even use his own presentations.
Grade based on about 5 homework assignments and 3 exams.  The material was not difficult, but was taught so poorly.  Bo is very hard to understand.  Went through the material EXTREMELY slowly.
He is very hard to understand and follow in lecture. 10/10 wouldn't recommend.

If you have a choice between Professor Yang and another professor take the other professor. Theres little to no point in going to lecture he is hard to understand and won't move to new ideas. Homework isn't too hard but its very time consuming with too many similar problems, one of which being due the day after spring break instead of the Tuesdays.

As a professor Yang really is not that great of a professor as he moves very slowly through the material and lectures drag on. The homework for this class is insanely long.  With all of this being said, his tests are very fair and he tests you on the basics for the most part making the class with Yang manageable.

Has spent the entire semester teaching us what a random variable is. Says the same things everyday and nobody learns anything from him. The only reason I would recommend this professor is if you wish to lower your IQ.

Yikes.. Bo means well and you can tell he is passionate and energetic when it comes to the material, but that's about it. Lectures are boring, confusing, and most times you leave forgetting you were even there in the first place. Homework is long and annoying and tests are hard. Try to avoid!!

Terrible Lecturer, you won't learn a thing. His powerpoint are a mess and half the time you don't know what he's talking about. Hope for a good TA or you're gonna be in a world of hurt. Exams are tough and long. Would not recommend.
Very dull lectures, struggles to explain concepts clearly. Lots of homework, but the exams aren't too difficult if you study and do the homework. Not an enjoyable experience
There is literally a 0% chance that you will enjoy having this professor.

Another worst instructor in this campus! Expect a lot of homework. His lecture is super boring. Can't explain the concept clearly due to his poor English. He likes saying 'Look at this figure and you can get this , and THEN you can get this."  I don't know how I can get it only by looking at this or that. And the exam is much harder than previous.

If you want a class where you can decide to go or not by feeling this is it. Most of the time your body is the only thing there in lec. Just read the slides on your own time. Homework is super easy if you go to discussion and read the slides. The answer is just there. Prof is helpful and willing to stay after lec to answer questions, or ask TA.

Lecture is rough. Hard to pay attention. One discussion a week is plenty to clearly and thoroughly cover a weeks worth of lecture material. Discussion worksheets are exactly like the homework and tests.  Follow along and take notes in discussion and you will be fine. Tests are straight forward.
